content.title: Financial Assistance for Setting Up of Sales Emporia by Industrial Associations, Handicrafts Societies and Recognized Institutions
content.details: The scheme 'Financial Assistance for Setting Up of Sales Emporia by Industrial Associations, Handicrafts Societies and Recognized Institutions' under 'Marketing And Publicity' was launched by the Department of Industries and Commerce, Union Territory of Puducherry. Through this scheme, financial support will be provided via the Industrial Associations, Handicrafts Societies and Recognized Institutions for promotion of Handicrafts, Coir, Jute, Micro and Small Industrial products, i.e. for acquiring suitable buildings/premises and providing infrastructure facilities for setting up of Sales emporia locally and in important cities in India.
benefits: Financial support via the Industrial Associations, Handicrafts Societies and Recognized Institutions.
Promotion of Handicrafts, Coir, Jute, Micro and Small Industrial products.
Acquisition of suitable buildings/premises and infrastructure facilities for setting up of Sales Emporia locally and in important cities in India.
eligibility: The applicant should be an artisan/unit industrialist from Puducherry.
content.application_process: Offline. The interested applicant should take print of the prescribed format of the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. The applicant should visit the District Industries Centre in person to submit the application form and documents.
documents_required: Proof of Registration as an Artisan/Unit Industrialist from Puducherry.
Any Other Document as Required by the District Industries Centre.

faqs.question: Is there a maximum limit on the financial assistance provided to the eligible entities?
faqs.answer: The scheme details do not specify a maximum limit. Applicants may refer to the scheme guidelines for information on the financial assistance ceiling.

faqs.question: Can applicants from other Union Territories apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme explicitly mentions that the applicant should be an artisan or unit industrialist from Puducherry.

faqs.question: What advantages do Handicrafts Societies gain through the scheme?
faqs.answer: Handicrafts Societies benefit from the scheme by obtaining financial assistance to establish Sales Emporia, boosting the visibility and market reach of their unique handcrafted products.

faqs.question: Can individuals with disabilities apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme does not explicitly mention any restrictions, so individuals with disabilities can apply if they meet the general eligibility criteria specified.

faqs.question: Is There Any Application Fee?
faqs.answer: No, applicants can rest assured that the entire application process is entirely free of cost. There are no fees associated with applying for this scheme.

faqs.question: Is There Any Compensation For The Delay In The Disbursal Of The Scheme Benefits?
faqs.answer: The guidelines do not mention any provision for compensation in the event of delayed disbursement of scheme benefits.

faqs.question: Can Applicants From The Neighboring States/UTs Also Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: This scheme is exclusively available to permanent residents of the Puducherry. Applicants from neighbouring States/UTs, among others, are not eligible to apply.

faqs.question: Is there an application deadline for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme guidelines do not mention any opening date or closing date for applications.

faqs.question: What sectors does the scheme focus on for promotion?
faqs.answer: The scheme focuses on the promotion of Handicrafts, Coir, Jute, and Micro and Small Industrial products.

faqs.question: Where can an applicant obtain the prescribed format of the application form?
faqs.answer: The interested applicant can download and print the application form from the official website of the Department of Industries and Commerce, Union Territory of Puducherry.

faqs.question: Can an applicant submit the application form through email or online platforms?
faqs.answer: No, the applicant needs to visit the District Industries Centre in person during working hours to submit the application form and documents.
